definition[0]: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
example[0]: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
example[1]: The company collects information about consumer trends.
example[2]: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
definition[1]: to get and keep objects of the same type, because you think they are attractive or interesting
definition[2]: to get money that you are owed
example[4]: The landlady came around once a month to collect the rent.
definition[3]: to ask people to give you money or goods for an organization that helps people
example[5]: I’m collecting for Children in Need.
definition[4]: if something collects in a place, or you collect it there, it gradually increases in amount
example[6]: Rain collected in pools on the road.
example[7]: solar panels for collecting energy from the sun
example[8]: I didn’t know what to do with it, so it just sat there collecting dust.
definition[5]: to receive something because you have won a race, game etc
example[9]: Redgrave collected his fifth Olympic gold medal in Sydney.
definition[6]: to come to a particular place in order to take someone or something away
example[10]: Martin’s gone to collect the children from school.
example[11]: I’ve got to go and collect the book I ordered from the library.
definition[7]: to come together gradually to form a group of people
example[12]: A crowd was beginning to collect around the scene of the accident.
example[14]: They have collected 650 signatures for their petition.
definition[8]: to collect information from different places, or to collect crops, flowers, wood etc, especially from the ground
example[15]: Computers make it easier to gather information.
definition[9]: to collect something such as information in an organized way
example[17]: When all the evidence is assembled, we will write our report.
definition[10]: to gradually collect more things of the same type over time
example[18]: He has built up one of the country’s finest collections of art.
definition[11]: to gradually get more and more of something such as money, possessions, or knowledge, over time. Accumulate is more formal than build up
example[19]: He is driven by the desire to accumulate wealth.
definition[12]: to collect a large amount of something such as money, information, or knowledge, over time
example[20]: Carnegie amassed a fortune in the steel industry.
definition[13]: to allow a debt to increase quickly, especially by spending too much
example[21]: He ran up huge gambling debts.
definition[14]: a short prayer in some Christian services
definition[15]: to arrange for cheques to be paid
example[22]: The district banks provide a variety of services for commercial banks, including collecting and clearing cheques.
definition[16]: to obtain payment of debts or taxes
example[23]: The company wasn’t aggressive about collecting debts.
example[24]: Russia’s public finances must be brought into order by collecting more taxes and cutting spending.
definition[17]: when you telephone someone collect, the person receiving the call pays for it
example[25]: Calling the US is very expensive from here - better to call collect.
